description:
I've always wanted desktop version on Ubuntu. Actually, I think it is better than app for Windows (at least when I saw it last time).
But everything is REALLY SMALL. I barely see anything.
Nice, says my web browser needs to be updated on yellow bar at the top...I needed this though rather than an extension in my browser asking me to relogin all the time with that full secret key
crashes if you try and resize or maximize the window
Works great on Pop_OS with Snapp Store - but says browser is out of date. I am not sure if that is a bad thing in a security sense.
summary: Works great on Pop_OS with Snap Store - but..

description: Keeps complaining about an out of date browser and keeps forgetting the master password. Useless.

I was really hopeful when i saw this but the wrapper uses an outadated browser as a base and even worse if you close and open it again it loses the configuration, some said that it forgets the master password, that is how 1password works on mac and windows, the browser version you can set it to not timeout
This is not really an app. It is just a web browser (an outdated one at that) that opens only 1Password website.

Buttons to copy password dont work
Buttons to view password are invisible!
summary: Boy does it have so many bugs!

description: Maybe it's just me, but this thing doesn't work! Thankfully there is an official version. My apologies to the Dev team, the effort is appreciated, but testing helps you not get such negative reviews :-)
summary: Doesn't work! Fails to copy passwords

description: Kann meinen PasswortContainer nicht verbinden. Entwickler werden immer geldgieriger.
Beste App mit allen Synchronisationsfeatures, die man braucht. Ja, es ist eine kostenpflichte App - dafür läuft sie einfach unkompliziert seit Jahren.
